title: 2014 dimensions?
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/solvable/462653cb84.9f273e321a.L9bYfD.jpg?width=250"}},{"type":"text","text":"
Consider a hypercube of side length 2 in a 2014-dimensional space. Inscribe a unit hypersphere in the hypercube. Inscribe a smaller hypersphere tangent to the unit hypersphere and the sides of the hypercube."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The radius of the smaller sphere can be written as "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{a-\sqrt{b}}{c}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"c"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are coprime positive integers. Find "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a+b+c"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Based on "},{"type":"text","text":"this problem","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":"."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Using Pythagoras' Theorem, the distance from the centre of the unit hypersphere to a vertex of the hypercube is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sqrt{2014}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Filling in one corner of the cube with progressively smaller tangential spheres, we find the sum of diameters to be "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\displaystyle 2 \sum_{n=0}^{\infty} a^{n} = \frac{2}{1-a}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is the ratio between adjacent radii."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Equating the former plus a radius 1 and the latter, we can solve for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":":"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{2}{1-a} = \sqrt{2014}+1 \longleftrightarrow a = 1-\frac{2}{\sqrt{2014}+1} = \boxed{\frac{2015-\sqrt{8056}}{2013}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Using this ratio, we can compute the smaller radius since "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"R = 1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"r = aR = a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"r"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"R"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are the small and big radii respectively."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Generally, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{2}{1-a} = \sqrt{n}+1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" dimensions."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Wish You a Merry Christmas and a Happy New Year

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Note: in this solution hypercube refers to the hypercube in "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2014"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" dimensions."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let the radius of an inscribed hypersphere in a hypercube be "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"r"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". By repeated Pythagoras' Theorem, the distance between the center of that hypercube to one of the corners is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\underbrace{\sqrt{r^2+r^2+\cdots +r^2}}_{2014\text{ }r^2\text{'s}}=r\sqrt{2014}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Thus, the distance between the center of the hypercube in the problem to the corner is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sqrt{2014}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Call the center of the hypercube "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"O_1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and the corner "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Call the intersection of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"O_1A"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to the hypersphere "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"X"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Note that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"OX=1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" because the hypersphere is a unit hypersphere. Now call the center of the smaller inscribed hypersphere "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"O_2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and its radius "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"r"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Note that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"XO_2=r"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" because the line connecting the centers of any two tangent hyperspheres goes through their tangency point. Also, by the lemma we proved above, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"O_2A=r\sqrt{2014}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"But wait: "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"O_1A=\sqrt{2014}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"O_1A=O_1X+XO_2+O_2A=1+r+r\sqrt{2014}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Thus, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sqrt{2014}=1+r+r\sqrt{2014}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Solving the linear system of equations gives "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"r=\boxed{\dfrac{2015-\sqrt{8056}}{2013}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" so our answer is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2015+8056+2013=\boxed{12084}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Consider the same problem on 2-space."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"https://i.imgur.com/evRxg7d.gif"}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Here, you'd be solving this: "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sqrt{2} = 1 + r + \sqrt{2} r"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"because "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sqrt{2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is the distance from the corner of the square to the center, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is the radius of the circle and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sqrt{2} r"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is the distance between the center of the second circle and the corner of the square."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Similar analogy in 2014-space follows where you solve:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sqrt{2014} = 1 + r + \sqrt{2014} r
\\ \implies \boxed{r = \frac{2015-2 \sqrt{2014}}{2013}} "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            It would be better if you proved that the analogy holds. Right now your argument is basically Engineer's Induction.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Nice! I was just about to look for a geometric approach, and this is perfect!

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Used the same approach  Agnishom .
Wish You a Merry Christmas and a Happy New Year

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Wish You a Merry Christmas and a Happy New Year

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

title: 2014 Frenzy with Squares
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find the last three digits of the alternating sum "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2014^2-2013^2+2012^2-2011^2+...+2^2-1^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Applying the identity:  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a^2-b^2=(a+b)(a-b)"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 2014^2-2013^2+2012^2-2011^2...2^2-1^1=(2014+2013)+(2012+2011)+(2010+2009)...+(2+1) "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"= \frac{2014 \times 2015 }{2}=2029105 "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So the answer is  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \boxed{105} "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Yes, but it still doesn't change anything as "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1^{n}=1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" with any value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

                                            Sorry, the power of 1 would be 2

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Here, if from the start, we evaluate consecutive two terms of the series, we get an AP as: "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4027,4023,....3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let us take "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a , l , d , n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" as the first term, last term, common difference and no. of terms of the AP resp."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a_{n}=3 \implies a+(n-1)d=3 \implies 4027+(n-1)(-4)=3 \implies 4(n-1)=4024 \implies n-1=1006 \implies n=1007"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So, there are 1007 terms in the AP as 3 is the last term."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now, Sum"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"=\frac{n}{2} (a+l) = \frac{1007}{2} (3+4027) = \frac{1007}{2}\times 4030= (1007\times 2015) = \boxed{2029105}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Here, we have the last 3 digits of the sum as "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\boxed{105}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"taking two terms and solving ,we get an A.P.  i.e.
4027 + 4023 + 4019 + .......................+3 ,
now ,  calculate no. of terms by  p = a + ( n-1 )d ,
  here ,  p =3 ,a=4027 , d = (-4)  ,   solving  we get  n=1007 ,
now , sum of series = n [ 2a +(n-1) d]  /2  ,
putting values we get sum =2029105 ,
so , last digits are  105"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Note that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2^{2} - 1^{2} = 3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4^{2} - 3^{2} = 7"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"6^{2} - 5^{2} = 11"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Generally:  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(2k)^{2} - (2k - 1)^{2} = 3 + 4(k - 1) = 4k - 1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So we can evaluate the last one:  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4(1007) - 1 = 4027"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now, we can sum that with the first one ("},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"), and we get "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4030"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". See that this will be repeating "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"503"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" times until you get to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1008^{2} - 1007^{2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".  Evaluating it similarly, as above, it is equal to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2015"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".  In conclusion, our answer is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4030\cdot503 + 2015 = 2029105"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", and so our answer is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\boxed {105}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2014^{2}-2013^{2}+2012^{2}-2011^{2}+.....+2^{2}-1^{2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"=(2014+2013)(2014-2013)+(2012+2011)(2012-2011)+...+(2+1)(2-1)"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"=(2014+2013)\times 1+(2012+2011)\times 1+...+(2+1)\times 1"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"=2014+2013+2012+2011+...+2+1=\frac{2014\times 2015}{2}=2029105"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
so, 105"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Taking the whole series by pairs of two, we get the required sum to be:3+7+11+....+4027 
This sums up to (2015)(1007) = 2029105."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
2014^2-2013^2+2012^2-2011^2+...+2^2-1^2 
"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
= (2014-2013)(2014+2013)+(2012-2011)(2012+2011)+...+(2-1)(2+1)
"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
=2014+2013+2012+2011+...+2+1
"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
=\frac{(1+2014)*2014}{2}
"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
=2029105
"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
get the last three digits, we will have the answer "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\boxed{105}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"First you realize that this is murica, the land of the free and the home of the brave"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Second, you realize 4-1 = 3
16-9 = 7
36-25 = 11 "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"and so on.."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Then using these murican powers, you realize using real eyes that:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This is just (1007) * (3+2012)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Each pair is a^2 - (a-1)^2 = a + a-1"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Series = 2014 + 2013 + 2012 + 2011 + ... + 1 = 2014 * 2015 / 2"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Sum of n = n/2(a=l)
                  = 2014/2(2014+1)
                  = 1007(2015)
                  = 2029105
So the last three digits are 1,0,5 =105"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"According to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" a^2 - b^2 = (a + b)(a - b) "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" (2014 + 2013)(2014 - 2013) + (2012 + 2011)(2012 - 2011) + \dots + (2 + 1)(2 - 1) "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" = 4027 + 4023 + \dots + 3 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"There are 1007 terms,"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So,
 "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" n = 1007 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" a_1 = 4027 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" a_n  = 3 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Using "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" S = \frac {n}{2}(a_1 + a_n) "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" S=\frac {1007}{2}(4027 + 3) "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" S=2029105 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 2029 \boxed{105} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So, the answer is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 105 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Using the algebraic identity "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a^2-b^2=(a+b)(a-b)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"we can rewrite our expression as "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(2014+2013)(2014-2013)+(2012+2011)(2012-2011)+..........+(2+1)(2-1)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"which is just "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2014+2013+2012+2011+............+3+2+1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".The sum is just"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{2014\cdot 2015}{2}=1007\cdot 2015"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Since we only want the last three digits,we look at the final expression "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\text{mod}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1000"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and that gives us 105."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Here we apply the formula a's power 2-b's power 2=(a-b)(a+b)
so 2014 power 2- 2013 power 2=(2014-2013)(2014+2013)
it will become 1*(2014+2013)=2014+2013 "},{"type":"hardBreak"},{"type":"text","text":"
finally we found a series:
2014+2013+. . . +2+1 and solve this with the formula n(n+1)/2
so 2014(2014+1)/2=2029105 and last three digits are 105"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"it can be write like this"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(2014 - 2013) (2014 + 2013) + (2012 - 2011)(2012+2011) + ... + (2-1)(2+1)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"it form an aritmethic formula"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Sn = "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{1}{2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" n (2a + (n - 1) b )"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Sn = "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{1}{2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" 2014 (2 . 1 + (2014-1) 1)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Sn = 1007 "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\times"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" 2015"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Sn = 2029105"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"the last three digits of the alternating sum is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\boxed{105}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"*we can rewrite the expression in the following way: *"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(2014^{2} - 2013^{2}) + (2012^{2} - 2011^{2}) + ................+(2^{2} - 1^{2})"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"bulletList","content":[{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"text","text":"by applying the formula* "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" a^{2} - b^{2} = (a+b)*(a -b)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" *,the expression becomes: *"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" (2014 - 2013)*(2014 + 2013) + (2012 - 2011)*(2012 + 2011) +................+(2 - 1)*(2 + 1)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"bulletList","content":[{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"text","text":"the final expression becomes: *"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 4027 + 4023 +.........+ 3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"this is nothing but an Arithmetic Progression of first term 4027 , nthn^{th}nth term 3 and common difference -4","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"bulletList","content":[{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"text","text":"the value of n  can be found out in the following manner*"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 3 = 4027 - ( n -1)* 4"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"equating this we get","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" n = 1007"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"sum of 1007 terms S =","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"  \frac{1007}{2}*( 4027 + 3)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" = ...........105"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"so the last three digits of the sum are 1 0 and 5","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"till  even factors of 4 answer is 0
upto 8 answer is 0
compute 6-4-2
we get 0
answer 0"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}
